title: Unit 0 Diagnostic Checkpoint: Readiness Boot Camp
description: Diagnostic assessment to identify readiness for Pre-Calculus content. Covers function notation and domain/range, solving all equation types from Algebra 2, factoring fluency, and graphing with transformations. Results drive targeted mini-reteach before Unit 1.

remediationStrategy.description: Students scoring below threshold on specific skill clusters receive focused mini-lessons on those skills only. Students at or above threshold advance directly to Unit 1.

clusters.reteachFocus: Evaluating f(x), composition f(g(x)), domain restrictions from fractions/radicals/logs, interval notation
Quadratic formula, rational equations with LCD, radical equations with extraneous check, exponential/log equations
Trinomials a≠1, grouping, sum/difference of cubes, simplifying rational expressions
Parent function library, transformation template g(x) = af(b(x-c))+d, identifying key features

assessmentProblems.question: For f(x) = (2x - 1)/(x² + x - 6), find: (a) f(4), (b) the domain in interval notation.
Find the domain of g(x) = √(6 - 2x) + ln(x + 1). Express in interval notation.
Given f(x) = x² - 3 and g(x) = 2x + 1, find: (a) f(g(x)), (b) g(f(x)), (c) f(g(-2)).
Solve: 4^(x - 3) = 8^(x + 1).
assessmentProblems.answer: Rewrite as powers of 2: (2²)^(x-3) = (2³)^(x+1). 2^(2x-6) = 2^(3x+3). Set exponents equal: 2x - 6 = 3x + 3 → -x = 9 → x = -9.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: √(5x + 1) = x + 1. Check for extraneous solutions.
assessmentProblems.answer: Square: 5x + 1 = x² + 2x + 1. Rearrange: x² - 3x = 0 → x(x - 3) = 0. x = 0 or x = 3. Check x=0: √1 = 1 = 0+1 ✓. Check x=3: √16 = 4 = 3+1 ✓. Both valid: x = 0 and x = 3.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve and express in interval notation: (x - 3)/(x + 2) > 0.
assessmentProblems.answer: Critical values: x = 3 (zero), x = -2 (undefined). Test intervals: x < -2: neg/neg = pos ✓. -2 < x < 3: neg/pos = neg ✗. x > 3: pos/pos = pos ✓. Solution: (-∞, -2) ∪ (3, ∞).

assessmentProblems.question: Starting from the parent function f(x) = √x, the function g(x) = -3√(x - 4) + 2 is formed. (a) List all transformations in order. (b) Find the domain and range of g. (c) Find the x-intercept.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) Shift right 4, vertical stretch by 3, reflect over x-axis, shift up 2. (b) Domain: [4, ∞). Range: (-∞, 2]. (c) 0 = -3√(x-4) + 2 → √(x-4) = 2/3 → x - 4 = 4/9 → x = 40/9 ≈ 4.44.

assessmentProblems.question: Identify the parent function and describe ALL key features (domain, range, intercepts, asymptotes, end behavior) for h(x) = 2/(x - 1) + 3.
assessmentProblems.answer: Parent: f(x) = 1/x. Transformations: right 1, vertical stretch by 2, up 3. VA: x = 1. HA: y = 3. Domain: (-∞, 1) ∪ (1, ∞). Range: (-∞, 3) ∪ (3, ∞). y-intercept: h(0) = 2/(-1) + 3 = 1. x-intercept: 0 = 2/(x-1) + 3 → 2/(x-1) = -3 → x - 1 = -2/3 → x = 1/3. End behavior: as x → ±∞, h(x) → 3.

assessmentProblems.question: SPIRAL: Solve the system: y = x² - 2x and y = x + 4.

answerKeys.pcu0-10: VA x=1, HA y=3, y-int 1, x-int 1/3
